meta.description: Quick character summary of Jenna Stannis

content.p: Blake meets Jenna and Vila in the transit cells, during The Way Back.
Jenna used to be a smuggler and is an excellent pilot, consorting with Tarvin, who we meet during Bounty.

figure.figcaption: Jenna and Blake spend the night up a tree during Duel.

content.p: The scene in Space Fall between Blake, Jenna and Avon establishes her character well - Jenna wants to believe in something, and chooses Blake.

During Cygnus Alpha, Jenna triggers a control on The Liberator which causes Zen to be loyal to her - and by extension, Blake and Avon. She describes the sensation thus: to be completely known. It's like ... innocence.

Their friendship is touching - she is loyal to him and he often selects her for missions, despite her lack of aptitude for violence. During the episode Duel, Sinofar selects Jenna as Blake's second, in his fight with Travis, because she wants Blake to understand the impact of the death of a friend.
Jenna is a strangely sexless character who only occasionally is the object of other's sexual interest, notably Tarvin and Renor.
Like Cally, Jenna is regrettably underused but Nation is consistent in allowing her to provide any exposition regarding space ships or piloting.
